page.title: 15Motorways
page.content: The first motorway in the country,M 1,runs beside the boundary of the area,close to Bricket Wood. For many years, there have been problems in the area from traffic congestion on the nearby main roads, making it difficult for people driving cars to actually get out of the villages. Now,the last stretch of M25 to be laid, runs through the area.At the moment,a wide stretch of clay runs through what was woods and fields;huge cranes and earth movers are everywhere,changing the landscape.It should be finished by 1986, when the area will have fast access to all parts of the country. One bit of land is thought to be the most valuable piece of land,in Europe if it is built on,and is called the 'Golden Triangle'.Bricket Wood people want it to be kept as farmland.
